item.title: BRAC Bank TARA, Green Delta Insurance host breast cancer awareness event
item.description: BRAC Bank TARA, in collaboration with Green Delta Insurance, hosted a discussion session titled ‘Rise Above Fear’ to mark Breast Cancer Awareness Month. The inspiring evening attended by 80 women customers and guests celebrated courage, compassion, and the shared commitment to advancin

item.title: Prof Yunus calls for preserving all records of National Consensus Commission
item.description: Chief Adviser Professor Muhammad Yunus on Monday highlighted the importance of preserving all documents, videos, audios and photographs related to the discussions from the formation of the National Consensus Commission to the formulation of its final recommendations, describing them as invaluable a

item.title: Gold price falls again within 24 hours
item.description: The price of gold in the local market has dropped again within just 24 hours, with the Bangladesh Jewellers Association (BAJUS) reducing the rate by Tk 3,674 per bhori (11.664 grams). In a press release issued on Monday night, BAJUS announced that the price of 22-carat gold will now stand at Tk 20

item.title: SUST forms 13-member election commission for SUCSU polls
item.description: Shahjalal University of Science and Technology (SUST) has formed a 13-member Election Commission for the upcoming Shahjalal University Central Students’ Union (SUCSU) elections, with Professor Dr. Abul Mukit Mokaddes of the Department of Industrial and Production Engineering appointed as the

item.title: UD case filed over falling bearing pad victim under Metrorail at Farmgate
item.description: An Unnatural Death (UD) case has been filed at Tejgaon Police Station after a pedestrian, identified as Abul Kalam Azad (35), was killed when a bearing pad fell from a metro rail pillar near Farmgate station in Dhaka on Sunday. Azad, hailed from Naria upazila in Shariatpur, died instantly around 1

item.title: Bangladesh fall short in chase as West Indies win first T20I
item.description: West Indies beat Bangladesh in the first T20I of a three-match series at the Bir Sreshtho Flight Lieutenant Matiur Rahman Stadium in Chattogram on Monday. With this win, they took the lead 1-0. West Indies won the toss and opted to bat first. They posted 165 for 3, with captain Shai Hope anchorin

item.title: Sarjis, ex-student leader trade barbs in Manikganj
item.description: A heated exchange has erupted between NCP Chief Organiser (North) Sarjis Alam and a former leader of the Students Against Discrimination Movement in Manikganj. item.title: Can Donald Trump serve a third term as US president?
item.description: President Donald Trump on Monday declined to dismiss speculation that he would seek a third term and said he hadn't considered whether he would go to court to contest the US Constitution's two-term limit for presidents. Here is a look at the legal barriers Trump faces. WHAT DOES THE CONSTITUTION
